result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard Brian Novotny was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $850 has been applied. Remaining fine to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Sentence to commence forthwith. The court deems the 48 hour requirement prior to huber satisfied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Brian Novotny

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: for Half-Priced Ignition Inerlock Device (IID) - Granted
from G & G Healthcare Services regarding the defendant's treatment

Case called @ 11:49 a.m. Defendant Richard Brian Novotny in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: 45 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 15 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, 24 mo DL rev/IID commencing today, the court has deemed the 48 hour requirement satisfied, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County Safe Streets Program, $1694 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The court voices no objection to a transfer to another facility. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

Prior: 103 Liberty St, Mauston, WI 53948

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Frank regarding TAD and request for adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 11:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Per Atty Frank - Def currently in treatment program in Miami Florida.  It is believed that matter will be resolved.  Court suggests Attorney Authorization or perhaps the Def appearing via telephone.   Def does reside in Juneau Co and will require immediate report date.  P/S Scheduled.  Safe Streets solely available to County residents.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions
from Atty Frank with request to adjourn 3/31/2015 STC due to calendar conflict - Request granted by the Court

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing or ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 3:24 PM: Defendant Richard Brian Novotny in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to obtain counsel - was not found eligible for SPD services due to employment.  Def has not yet tried to retain his own counsel.  Court believes the Def has the means to retain his own counsel - not appropriate for Dean Appointment for his level of earnings.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
